page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Keyworth goes back many hundreds of years.The past has left us with many historic places and buildings,such as the Barn,church and some other houses situated around the centre of Keyworth Take 1798 there was only 56 buildings in Keyworth and only 7 streets. Comparing that to today there is now over 1000 houses and over 50 streets Before enclosure in 1798 most people in Keyworth used to own strips of land and were strip farmers some people were frame work knitters and did other house jobs.But other people had strips and did other jobs such as the Rectors and the Lord of the Manor.They paid other people to do their strips. Most other people were too poor and had to do the work themselves.In Keyworth on Debdale Lane and Nottingham Road you can see clear remains of the bumpy ground used for farming.
